meanings.definition: A person or thing that perplexes.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious puzzle was a real perplexer for the detective.
meanings.sent2: The riddle was a real perplexer for the children at the party.
meanings.sent3: The perplexer of the group was the tricky math problem that no one could solve.
meanings.sent4: The maze was a perplexer, leading the adventurers in circles.
meanings.sent5: The crossword puzzle was a challenging perplexer for the avid solver.

meanings.sent1: The perplexer situation left everyone unsure of what to do next.
meanings.sent2: The complex instructions on the test were quite perplexer for the students.
meanings.sent3: The perplexer directions on the map led them in circles around the park.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events was a real perplexer for the audience.
meanings.sent5: The constantly changing weather was a perplexer for the farmers trying to plan their crops.
